trans-unit.source: Represents Abstract Syntax Notation One (ASN.1)-encoded data.
Abstract Syntax Notation One (ASN.1), which is defined in CCITT Recommendation X.208, is a way to specify abstract objects that will be serially transmitted.
The set of ASN.1 rules for representing such objects as strings of ones and zeros is called the Distinguished Encoding Rules (DER), and is defined in CCITT Recommendation X.509, Section 8.7.
These encoding methods are currently used by the cryptography namespace in the .NET Framework.
Note that if an unknown data type is encountered while accessing an instance of this class, data is returned as a hexadecimal string.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData"></xref> class using a byte array.
A byte array that contains Abstract Syntax Notation One (ASN.1)-encoded data.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData"></xref> class using an instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData"></xref> class.
This constructor makes a copy of the specified <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData> instance.
An instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData"></xref> class.
asnEncodedData is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData"></xref> class using an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Oid"></xref> object and a byte array.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Oid"></xref> object.
A byte array that contains Abstract Syntax Notation One (ASN.1)-encoded data.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData"></xref> class using a byte array.
A string that represents <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Oid"></xref> information.
A byte array that contains Abstract Syntax Notation One (ASN.1)-encoded data.
Copies information from an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData"></xref> object.
This method copies information to an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData> object based on the specified <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData> object.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData"></xref> object to base the new object on.
asnEncodedData is `null`.
Returns a formatted version of the Abstract Syntax Notation One (ASN.1)-encoded data as a string.
Use this method if you need to print Abstract Syntax Notation One (ASN.1)-encoded data or output the information to a text box.
Use the `multiLine` parameter to control the layout of the output.
`true` if the return string should contain carriage returns; otherwise, `false`.
A formatted string that represents the Abstract Syntax Notation One (ASN.1)-encoded data.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Oid"></xref> value for an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData"></xref> object.
This property can be used to provide information about the Abstract Syntax Notation One (ASN.1)-encoded data, such as the algorithm used to encrypt the data.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Oid"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the Abstract Syntax Notation One (ASN.1)-encoded data represented in a byte array.
This property is the easiest way to access the information in an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData> object.
A byte array that represents the Abstract Syntax Notation One (ASN.1)-encoded data.
The value is `null`.
